- so you have a problem with people earning a living wage? How MAGA of you. Dismissed.

To quickly make the assumption I’m a MAGA means you jump to conclusions a lot, which means your reasoning is highly flawed. Just because I raised a complaint based on what I heard from workers at my local Costco, does not automatically mean I’m a MAGA. Try to follow reason and logic next time.
Interesting because you made a whole lot of assumptions yourself. Suggesting that wage increases caused the prices to ‘skyrocket’.

Maybe if you would have used your pea-sized homosapien brain correctly, you would have read what I posted. It was based on my experience going to a local Costco and talking to some workers about the price increases.

When the economy is weak, more people are shopping at Costco than Walmart because Costco’s bulk buying and luxury items attract higher-income shoppers looking for value. Walmart, on the other hand, is struggling to attract budget-conscious consumers who are trading down to dollar stores, making it a risky investment as they lose market share.
